title: Will printer ink dry up? - Quora

response.answer_text: In my experience,yes,they will dry out and possibly clog the print nozzles,and then you have a problem. You are told to print a test page periodically if you don’t do that much printing. That is why I did not replace my last inkjet printer. I have a $79 b&w laser-jet that uses toner powder that does not dry out. You can get color laser-jet printers,but the cartridges can cost an arm and a leg. 99% of my printing is text,so b&w is good enough for me. Non brand name B&W cartridges can be gotten on Amazon for a huge savings. I got my laser jet in the fall,and am still using the original cartridge. They seem to last a lot longer than inkjet cartridges.

Yes, it will. When you don’t need to use your inkjet printer, you still need to print the test paper to keep your printer run smoothly. Why are we still need to these process on our printer? Because inkjet printer will dry up when you have a long time not to use that, it will cause the printer’s printhead show some problems that cost you a lot to fix it, such as the printer won’t print, you need to find out the problems between printer or cartridges, and it may takes your time to buy another printer for printing. So, let’s keep your printer work 2–3 times a week to keep your printer run better.

Yes, Ink cartridges dry out over time because when you are sitting in your machine for a long period, it will eventually dry up and become unusable. So, always printing once every couple of weeks to keep your ink cartridges operating smoothly. Also, printhead cleaning can regularly get an idle cartridge up and running again. If dried up ink is making a clog, the cleaning function works to prime your cartridges.

Sure. It’s designed to dry up once printed on paper when it is exposed to air. And there is always s little air that enters the ink cartridge while printing. So it’s onlt a matter of time before the ink inside the cartridge dries up. It’s therefore a good idea to print something occasionally to keep ink flowing. With inkjet printers I recommend printing at least once a month.
Im sure like any other ink, if not used for a long time and in a dry hot place, that it could dry up. Im not sure if using a little alcohol on it would work the same as with ink pens or shared thou.
